dialogues.speaker: CAMERA FRAME
dialogues.text: directly behind him. On the right side, we see the figure Col.Landa, from behind, watching the guests entering the cinema. On the left side of frame, is the cinema entrance from a looking down perspective of the guests entering th building. THEN... .A THINK BUBBLE, like in a comic book, appears on the lef side of frame, obscuring the cinema entrance. Inside of L think bubble, a little scene plays out.

dialogues.speaker: THINK BUBBLE
dialogues.text: Inside a hospital room filled with DOCTORS, NURSES, and a PATIENT in a hospital bed. Then Col.Landa enters the room screams at everybody;

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: I want everybody out of this room! They start to leave.

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: That means now, goddamnit! They RUSH OUT. He walks over to the Patient in the hospital bed, Its non other then SGT.WILLI, and yes, he's still alive. Landa pulls up a chair next to the bed, sits down.

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: Can you speak, Sgt?

dialogues.speaker: SGT.WILLI
dialogues.text: (WEAKLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes Colonel.

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: Tell me everything that happened in there? The THINK BUBBLE DISSOLVES away, reveling the entrance ag and as if on perfect cue, in walks Bridget Von Hammersmar dressed lovely, leg in a big white cast. The three baster their tuxedos, flank her.

dialogues.speaker: CU COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: smiles. He descends the stairs, towards the four saboteurs... They speak in GERMAN, SUBTITLED in ENGLISH;

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: Fraulein Von Hammersmark, what has befallen Germany's most elegant swan?

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGET
dialogues.text: Colonel Landa, it's been years. Dashing as ever I see.

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: Flattery will get you everywhere, fraulein. They chuckle, and air kiss.

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: So what's happened to your lovely leg, a by product of kicking ass in the German cinema, no doubt.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGET
dialogues.text: Save your flattery, you old dog. I know too many of your former conquests, to fall into that honey pot. Chuckle-chuckle...

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: Seriously, what happened?

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGET
dialogues.text: Well, I tried my hand, foolishly I might add, at mountain climbing. And this was the result.

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: Mountain climbing? That's how you injured your leg, mountain climbing?

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGET
dialogues.text: Believe it or not, yes it is. A brief moment passes between the two... THEN... The Colonel BURSTS OUT with UPROARIOUS LAUGHTER. So uproa in fact, that it's quite disconcerting to the four sabote The Colonel begins to regain his composure...

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: Forgive me, fraulein. I don't mean laugh at your misfortune. It's just .mountain climbing? I'm curious fraulein, what could of ever compelled you to undertake such a foolhardy endeavor? The Double meaning is not lost on the German actress.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGET
dialogues.text: Well, I chant be doing it again, I can tell you that.

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: That cast looks as fresh as my old Uncle Gustave, when were you climbing this mountain, last night?

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGET
dialogues.text: Very good eye, Colonel. It happened yesterday morning.

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: Hummm. And where exactly in Paris is this mountain? This stops her for a seconded. Then Landa laughs it off, taking them off the hook.

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: I'm just teasing you, fraulein. You know me, I tease rough. So who are your three handsome escorts?

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGET
dialogues.text: I'm afraid neither three speak a word of German. Their friends of mine from Italy. This is a wonderful Italian stuntman, Antonio Margheriti. (Meaning Aldo) A very talented cameraman, Enzo Gorlomi. (Meaning Donny) And Enzo's camera assistant, Dominick Decocco. The German fraulein turns to the three tuxedo wearing Basterds.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGET
dialogues.text: (ITALIAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, this is a old friend, Col. Sans Landa of the S.S. The Basterds know only too well who Landa the Jew Hunter but they can't show it.

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: Margheriti...? (ITALIAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I saying it correctly...? .Margheriti?

dialogues.speaker: LT. ALDO
dialogues.text: (ITALIAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Correct.

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: (ITALIAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margheriti.... Say it for me once please...?

dialogues.speaker: LT. ALDO
dialogues.text: Margheriti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 13ZГѓВўГўВ‚В¬Г‚Вў

dialogues.text: I'm sorry, again...?

dialogues.speaker: LT.ALDO
dialogues.text: I4argheriti.

dialogues.text: Once more... .?

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: Nargheriti. (FRENCH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means daisies, I believe. Turning his gaze to Donny.

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: (ITALIAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name again?

dialogues.speaker: SGT.DONOWITZ

dialogues.text: Again... .?

dialogues.text: One more time, but let me really hear the music in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gorlomi. Now to Hirschberg...

dialogues.text: And you? Then Hischberg breaks out the best Italian accent of the GROUP;

dialogues.speaker: HIRSCHBERG

dialogues.text: Dominick Decocco?

dialogues.speaker: HIRSCHBERG
dialogues.text: Dominick Decocco.

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: Bravo... . Bravo.

dialogues.text: (GERMAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, my two cameraman friends need to find there seats. Col.Landa stops a WAITER with a tray of champagne glasses

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: (GERMAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so fast, lets enjoy some champagne. Everyone gets a glass.

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: (FRENCH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Oh, Mademoiselle Mimieux, please join us, I have some friends I'd like you to meet. Shosanna joins the circle, and is handed a champagne glas This is the first moment The Basterds are aware of Shosan

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: (FRENCH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I say Mademoiselle, you look divine.

dialogues.speaker: SHOSANNA
dialogues.text: (FRENCH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merci'.

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: (GERMAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This lovely young lady, is Mademoiselle Emmanuelle Mimieux, this is her cinema, and she is our hostess for the evening. (FRENCH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Mademoiselle, this battered, broken, and none worse for the wear German goddess, is Bridget Von Hammersmark.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGET
dialogues.text: Bonjour.

dialogues.speaker: SHOSANNA
dialogues.text: Bon jour.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGET
dialogues.text: (FRENCH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid my companions don't speak any French, there Italian. This is Antonino, Enzo, and Dominick. All three smile goofy spaghetti bender smiles.

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: (FRENCH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually fraulein Von Hammersmarks Italian associates, need help finding there seats. Perhaps Mademoiselle Mimieux would be so kind to escort them?

dialogues.speaker: SHOSANNA
dialogues.text: (FRENCH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would be my pleasure. Let me see your tickets? Donny hands her two tickets. She indicates for them to fo Donny and Hirschberg both exchange one last look with Ald then follow the young french girl into the auditorium.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: The cinema auditorium is filling up quickly with grey and uniforms. Shosanna finds the two counterfeit Italians their seats. After she points out their seats, she turns to leave... Hirschberg... .reaches out and grabs her wrist. He looks her in the face, and filled with tremendous guil because if he's successful tonight he's going to blow thi cute French girl to smithereens, he says;

dialogues.speaker: HIRSCHBERG
dialogues.text: Grazie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 13r. The cute French Girl looks back at the goofy looking Ital boy with slicked back hair, that makes him look kind of Jewish, with tremendous guilt, knowing if she is successf tonight, she's going to burn him alive, and says;

dialogues.speaker: SHOSANNA
dialogues.text: Prego.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO LOBBY
dialogues.text: They begin flicking the lights on and off. A GERMAN SOLDI YELLS in GERMAN in the lobby;

dialogues.speaker: GERMAN SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Take your seats! The show is about to begin! Everybody take your seatsl Col.Landa, Lt.Aldo, and Bridget are still together.

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: (GERMAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must call The Fuhrer. He doesn't want to make his entrance untill everybody seated. Come with me Frau Von Hammersmark. The Fuhrer has heard your here, and he wishes to commend you personally.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGET
dialogues.text: (GERMAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? Why?

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: (GERMAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be modest. Everybody is quite taken with your resolve. A accident, like you've just experienced, and yet you still show up to to a important Party event. The Fuhrer was quite adamant in his gratitude. We'll use Mademoiselle Mimieux's office. (To Aldo in Italian) I'm afraid I must rob you of your companion, but only for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGET
dialogues.text: (ITALIAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, apparently The Fuhrer wishes to commend me.

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: (ITALIAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait here a moment. I promise I won't detain her long. What are ether of them suppose to do, argue? Col.Landa goes over to one of the Nazi GAURD/USHER, and whispers in his ear, gesturing toward Aldo. Like he's say leave the boy alone, till we come back... .Or is he? Col.Landa limps Bridget away towards Shosannas office. As Aldo stands in the lobby, more and more people enter t auditorium, till it's only Aldo and the six Nazi Gaurd/Us in the now vacant lobby.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Shosanna's cinema manager office. It's small, cluttered, dominated by a desk. They both enter. Col.Landa closes the door behind him, and LOCKS IT. Bridget notices, but says nothing. Now the two Germans are alone.

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: Have a seat fraulein. Pointing at one lone chair in front of the desk. She lowers herself in the chair. Instead of moving around to the other side of the desk, opposite her. The SS Colonel pulls another little chair o and places it in front of the fraulein. He sits. Their knees almost touching. The colonel points to the foot not in the cast.

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: (GERMAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see your foot.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGET
dialogues.text: (GERMAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I beg your pardon?
Patting his lap.

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: Put your foot in my lap.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGET
dialogues.text: Colonel, you embarrass me.

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: I assure you fraulein, my intention is not to flirt. Patting his lap more with more aggression. The nervous fraulein, lifts up her strapy dress shoe encl foot, and places it in the Colonel's lap. The Colonel, very delicately, unfastens the thin straps t hold the frauleins shoe on her foot... .He removes the shoe... .Leaving only the frauleins bare foot... THEN... He removes from his heavy SS coat pocket, the pretty dres the fraulein left behind at La Louisiane... He slips it on her foot... .it fits like a glove. Bridget knows she's BUSTED. Col.Landa smiles and says in ENGLISH;

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: What's that American expression... "if the shoe fits...you must wear it". He removes her foot from his lap.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGET
dialogues.text: (GERMAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What now Colonel?

dialogues.speaker: COL LANDA
dialogues.text: (GERMAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you admit you treachery? She stares defiant daggers into him.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGET
dialogues.text: (GERMAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only thing I will admit to, is resisting you... (ENGLISH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sons-a-bitches.. (GERMAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .to my last breath.

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: (GERMAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Resist to your last breath"? SUDDENLY... Hans LUNGES forward, putting his strong mitts around Brid Von Hammersmarks lily white delicate neck, and with all t violence of a Lion in mid-pounce, SQUEEZES with all his M Bridgets face turns tomato RED, as the VEINS in her face BULGE, and her esophagus is CRUSHED in his GRIP. With a violent YANK, he JERKS her TO THE FLOOR. She TUMBL out of the chair, Landa never releasing his GRIP around h throat. Nov fully on top of her, he BEARS DOWN, SQUEEZING VERY LIFE OUT OF HER. Every thing he has, he brings to be the elegant ladies neck. Then, to finally finish her off, he begins BANGING THE BA HER HEAD, HARD AGAINST THE FLOOR...

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: She's dead. He releases the grip around her throat. His hands are TREMBLING... He rises. Strangling the very life out of somebody with your bear h is the most violent act a human being can commit. Also, only humans strangle, the opposable thumbs being qu important part of the endeavor. As Hans Landa stands, the sheer violence he had to call on to accomplish this task, still surges through him. He tries to gain control of the trembling, that is rippling through his body. He takes ou silver SS FLASK(filled with peach schnapps), and knocks b a couple of swigs. He holds his hand out in front of him. TREMBLING is beginning to subside. He picks up the teleph

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 139- Into the phone in German he says;

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: Inform The Fuhrer the audience has taken there seats, and we're ready to begin. Step one, in Hans master plan, done. He then dials another number...

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Aldo in the lobby... WHEN... .he's JUMPED by the SIX NAZI USHERS... He's THROWN ROUGHLY to the ground face first. Like the mo day Secret Service, within seconds, his wrists are handcu behind his back, he's searched, they find the BOMB attach his ankle, it's removed, a BLACK CLOTH BAG is pulled over head, then he's hoisted up, and RUSHED out of the buildin This happens in mere seconds, and quietly too, no one in auditorium is none the wiser...

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: ,including Donowitz and Hirschberg, sitting amongst the master race, waiting for showtime.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: The Six Nazi Soldiers, hustle the hooded Aldo, down the r carpet, then into the alley besides the cinema. Aldo's put up against a wall. Inside the black hood, he's SCREAMING every insulting thi about Germany, Germans, German food, German shepherd... anything.

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA'S VOICE, (OS)
dialogues.text: Shut up! The faceless black hood does. Col.Landa, now standing directly in front of his hooded prisoner, says in ENGLISH;

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: As Stanley said to Livingston; Lt.Aldo Raine, I presume?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I 'to.

dialogues.speaker: LT. ALDO
dialogues.text: Hans Landa?

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: You've had a nice long run, Aldo. Alas, your now in the hands of the SS. My hands to be exact. And they've been waiting along time, to touch you. He reaches out with his finger, and lightly touches Aldo' face right in the middle of the hood. Aldo's head VIOLENTLY FLINCHES.

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: Caught ya flinching. In German, he orders the men put Aldo in the back of a tr Aldo, bound, and bagged, is put in the truck. Also in the truck is Utivich, wearing a makeshift chauffeurs uniform, bound, and bagged like the Lieutenant. The Truck drives off. Col.Landa turns around, and SEES FROM A DISTANCE, Hitlers motorcade pull up to the cinema.. Then the Fuhrer, Goebbe Francesca, and the rest of the entourage, make there way the red carpet into the cinema. Landa smiles.

dialogues.speaker: EXT TRUCK, (MOVING)
dialogues.text: We see the truck leaving the city of Paris, under the vei night. We also seem to be leaving the drama of Operation Kino.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: The two hooded prisoners, bounce along in the back of the truck. Utivich, is crying inside his hood.

dialogues.speaker: LT.ALDO
dialogues.text: Utivich?

dialogues.speaker: UTIVICH
dialogues.text: Is that you Lieutenant?

dialogues.speaker: LT. ALDO
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: lyl.

dialogues.speaker: UTIVIC
dialogues.text: Do you know what happened to Donny? Hirchberg? The woman?

dialogues.speaker: LT.ALDO
dialogues.text: No I do not.

dialogues.speaker: UTIVICH
dialogues.text: Lieutenant, sorry I'm crying.

dialogues.speaker: LT. ALDO
dialogues.text: Nothin to be sorry about, son. This bag, get to anyone.

dialogues.speaker: UTIVICH
dialogues.text: Not exactly John Wayne, am I?

dialogues.speaker: LT.ALDO
dialogues.text: John Waynes a pampered movie star. He burst into tears, if his cook, busts his yoke at breakfast. Just try puttin a bag over his head, and hear what kinda sounds he makes. Utivich, giggles through the tears.

dialogues.speaker: LT.ALDO
dialogues.text: I just want you to know, son, I was real proud of you tonight. Learnin how to drive overnight. Driving in that Limo line. You was in the hot seat, son, and you stood up real good. Utivich Cries LOUDER. Aldo takes his foot, finds Utivichs foot, and places his on top. The TOUCH has a slight calming effect on Utivich. In the darkness, Utivich has reclaimed his dignity.

dialogues.speaker: EXT- COUNTRY TAVERN
dialogues.text: The truck pulls up to a small tavern outside of Paris(not Louisaiane), The two hooded prisoners, are walked inside the establish

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: The hooded men are lead into the closed for business, but for something else, rustic tavern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 0The Nazi Guards, unlock the handcuff, then sit them down Then, simultaneously, the hoods are YANKED OFF. The two prisoners, are seated at a table, in what they ca see, is a rustic tavern. On the table is one telephone, o bottle of Chianti, and three glasses. And on the opposite of the table, sits Colonel Hans Landa. A NAZI SOLDIER sits posted at  a impressive looking two w radio set up in the tavern. Colonel Lands starts in right away at the two baffled, discombobulated American soldiers. They will only speak ENGLISH in the scene.

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: Italian? Really? (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What could you have possibly been thinking?

dialogues.speaker: LT. ALDO
dialogues.text: Well, I speak alittle Italian -

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: I speak a little Tagalog, but I wouldn't begin to presume I could pass for Filipino. Don't get me wrong, I understand you were in a pickle, what with you losing your Germans. And I have nothing but admiration for improvisation. Still.... Chico Marx is more convincing. if the three of you had shown up to the premiere dressed in womans attire, it would have been more convincing. Landas eyes go to the Two Nazi Guards behind the prisoner

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: (GERMAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may leave us. But stay alert outside. They exit, leaving the Colonel, the Lieutenant, the Private and a German Radio Man in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: So your Aldo the Apache?

dialogues.speaker: LT. ALDO
dialogues.text: So your The Jew Hunter?

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: Jew Hunter, (pfuit), I'm a detective. A damn good detective. Finding people is my specialty. So naturally, I worked for the Nazi's finding people. And yes, some of them were Jews. But Jew Hunter? Just the name that stuck.

dialogues.speaker: UTIVICH
dialogues.text: Well you do hafts admit, it is catchy.

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: Do you control the nicknames, your enemies bestow on you? Aldo the Apache and The Little Man?

dialogues.speaker: UTIVICH
dialogues.text: What do you mean, The Little Man?

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: The Germans nickname for you.

dialogues.speaker: UTIVICH
dialogues.text: The Germans nickname for me is, The Little Man?

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: Or "The Little One, ether one means you. And as if to make my point, I'm a little surprised how tall you were in real life. I mean, your a little fellow. But not circus midget little, as your reputation would suggest.

dialogues.speaker: LT.ALDO
dialogues.text: Where is my men? Where is Bridget Von Hammersmark?

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: Bridget Von Hammersmark. Oh I'm sure she's in whatever, big bubbling cesspool in hell, the devil reserves for traitors of her ilk.

dialogues.speaker: COL. LANDA
dialogues.text: (COR'T)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, lets just say, she got what she deserved. And when you purchase friends like Bridget Von Hammersmark, you get what you pay for. Now as far as your Pisanos, Sgt.Donowitz, and Pt.Hirschberg-

dialogues.speaker: LT. ALDO
dialogues.text: How do you know our names?

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: Lt.Aldo, if you don't think I wouldn't interrogate every single one of your swastika marked survivors... .? We simply aren't operating on the level of mutual respect I assumed. Now, back to the whereabouts of your two Italian saboteurs. At this moment, both Hirschberg, and Donowitz, should be sitting in the very seats we left them in. Seats, 0023 and 0024, if my memory serves. Explosives, still around there ankle, still ready to explode. And your mission, some would call a terrorist plot, as of this moment, is still a go. The two Basterds don't believe this. It can't be true.

dialogues.speaker: LT. ALDO
dialogues.text: That's a pretty exciting story. What's next, Eliza on the ice?

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: However, all I have to do, is pick pick up that phone right there. Inform the cinema, and your plans kupet.

dialogues.speaker: LT. ALDO
dialogues.text: IF, their still there, and IF their still alive, and that's one big IF, there ain't no way, you gonna take them boys without settin off them bombs.

dialogues.speaker: M
dialogues.text: I have no doubt, and yes, some Germans will die., and yes, it will ruin the evening, and yes, Goebbels will be very very very mad at you for what you've done to his big night. But you won't get Hitler, you won't get Goebbels, you won't get Gering, and you won't get Boorman. And you need all four to end the war. (PAUSE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if I don't pick up that phone, right there, you may very well get all four. And if you get all four, you end the war...tonight. The Nazi Colonel lifts up the bottle of Chianti, and fill three glasses. As he pours, he says;

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: So gentlemen, lets discuss the prospect of ending the war-tonight. All three have their Chianti filled glasses.

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: So the way I see it, since Hitlers death, or possible rescue, rests solely on my reaction...If I do nothing ...it's as if I'm causing his death, even more then yourselves. Would you agree?

dialogues.speaker: LT. ALDO
dialogues.text: I guess so.

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: How about you Uitivich?

dialogues.speaker: UITIVICH
dialogues.text: I guess so too.

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: Good, we more or less, all agree. Gentlemen, I have no intention, of Killing Hitler, and killing Goebbels, and Killing Gerring, and killing Boorman, not to mention winning the war single handedly for the allies, only later, to find myself standing before a Jewish tribunal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I q Now they get it.

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: If you want to win the war, tonight, We have to make a deal.

dialogues.speaker: LT.ALDO
dialogues.text: What kinda deal?

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA

And it was my placement, of Lt.Raines dynamite in Hitler and Goebbels opera box that assured there demise. By the way, that last part is actually true.

dialogues.text: Herrman, hand them your weapon. He does. Col.Landa hands over his LUGER, and his very cool looking DAGGER.

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: I am officially surrendering myself over to you, Lt.Raine. We are your prisoners.

dialogues.speaker: LT.ALDO
dialogues.text: Thank you very much Colonel. Uitivich, cuff the Colonel's hands behind his back.

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: Is that really necessary? As Uitivich cuffs the. Colonels hands behind his back, Al SAYS;

dialogues.speaker: LT.ALDO
dialogues.text: I'm a slave to appearances. Then Aldo takes the Luger, and SHOOTS HERRMAN DEAD. The bound Col.Landa is appalled.

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: Are you mad? What have you done? I made a deal with your General for that mans life!

dialogues.speaker: LT. ALDO
dialogues.text: Yeah, they made that deal, but they don't give a fuck about him, they need you.

dialogues.speaker: COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: You'll be shot for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: t 6 q.

dialogues.speaker: LT.ALDO
dialogues.text: Raw I don't think so, more like I'll be chewed out. I've been chewed out before. You know, Uitvich and myself, heard that deal you made with the Brass. End the war tonight? I'd make that deal. How bout you Uitivich, you make that deal?

dialogues.speaker: UITIVICH
dialogues.text: I'd make that deal.

dialogues.speaker: LT.ALDO
dialogues.text: I don't blame ya. Damn good deal. And that pretty little nest ya feathered for yourself. Well, if your willing to barbecue the whole high command, I suppose that's worth certain considerations. Now I don't care about you gettin pensions, merit badges, ticker tape parades, who gives a damn, let's all go home. But .1do have one question? When you go to your little place on Nantuckett Island, I image you gonna take off that handsome looking SS uniform of yours, ain't ya? For the first time in the movie, Col.Landa doesn't-respon

dialogues.speaker: LT.ALDO
dialogues.text: That's what I thought. Now that... .I can't abide. How bout you Uitivich, can you abide it?

dialogues.speaker: UITIVICH
dialogues.text: Not one damn bit, sir.

dialogues.speaker: LT.ALDO
dialogues.text: I mean if I had my way, you'd wear that goddamn uniform for the rest of your pecker suckin life. But I'm aware that's ain't practical. I mean at some point ya gotta hafta take it off. He opens LandaSS DAGGER, and holds the BLADE in front of face.

dialogues.speaker: LT.ALDO
dialogues.text: So I'm gonna give you a little somethin you can't take off.

dialogues.speaker: CU COL.LANDA
dialogues.text: The Dagger has just completed carving a swastika deep int forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the ground, looking up at Aldo, bloody knife in hand, straddles him.. And Uitivich, who's next to him. The two Basterds admire Aldo's handiwork.

dialogues.speaker: LT.ALDO
dialogues.text: You know somethin Uitivich, I think this just might be my masterpiece.
